parametrized_description: A vine company sells two types of bottles: vintage and regular. A vintage bottle holds VintageBottleCapacity milliliters of vine, while a regular bottle holds RegularBottleCapacity milliliters of vine. The company has TotalAvailableVine milliliters of vine available. The number of regular bottles must be at least RegularToVintageMinRatio times the number of vintage bottles. Additionally, at least MinVintageBottles vintage bottles must be produced. The objective is to maximize the total number of bottles produced.

VintageBottleCapacity.description: Capacity of a vintage bottle in milliliters

RegularBottleCapacity.description: Capacity of a regular bottle in milliliters

RegularToVintageMinRatio.description: Minimum ratio of regular bottles to vintage bottles

MinVintageBottles.description: Minimum number of vintage bottles to be produced

NumberVintageBottles.description: The number of vintage bottles to produce

NumberRegularBottles.description: The number of regular bottles to produce

constraints.description: The total amount of vine used by vintage and regular bottles must not exceed TotalAvailableVine milliliters.
The number of regular bottles must be at least RegularToVintageMinRatio times the number of vintage bottles.
At least MinVintageBottles vintage bottles must be produced.

objective.description: Maximize the total number of bottles produced.
